info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 01 at 1:50PM PDT until September 01 at 2:45PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Imperial County in southeastern California... Riverside County in southern California... * Until 245 PM PDT. * At 150 PM PDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles west of Westmorland to near Imperial, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... El Centro, Brawley, Imperial, Salton City, Holtville, Westmorland, Bombay Beach, El Centro Naval Airfield, Calipatria, Slab City, Imperial Hot Mineral Springs, Alamorio, Wiest, Niland, and Heber. This includes the following highways... CA Interstate 8 between mile markers 34 and 54. CA Route 78 between mile markers 6 and 33. CA Route 111 between mile markers 4 and 65. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
